\begin{document}

\title{Finding $p$}
\maketitle

\section{Rep agent with capital CES preferences}

We start with the Planner's problem since the welfare theorems hold
in this case. The guess for $p$ can then be obtained from the optimal
allocation. 
\[
\max_{c_{c},c_{s},n,m,k_{c},k_{s}}E_{0}\sum_{t}\beta^{t}\frac{\left[\omega c_{c,t}^{\rho}+(1-\omega)c_{s,t}^{\rho}\right]^{\frac{1-\sigma}{\rho}}}{1-\sigma}-\frac{\left[\varphi n_{t}^{\varrho}+(1-\varphi)m_{t}^{\varrho}\right]^{\frac{1+\gamma}{\varrho}}}{1+\gamma}
\]
 subject to 
\[
c_{c}+k_{t+1}=(1-\delta)k_{t}+Ak_{c,t}^{\theta}n_{t}^{1-\theta}
\]

\[
c_{s}=Zk_{s,t}^{\nu}m_{t}^{1-\nu}
\]
\[
k_{c,t}+k_{s,t}=k_{t}
\]

The FOC for the planner's problem are The FOC for this problem are
\[
\omega c_{t}^{-\sigma}\left(\frac{c_{c,t}}{c_{t}}\right)^{\rho-1}=\phi_{c,t}
\]
\[
(1-\omega)c^{-\sigma}\left(\frac{c_{s_{t}}}{c_{t}}\right)^{\rho-1}=\phi_{s,t}
\]
\[
\varphi l^{\gamma}\left(\frac{n_{t}}{l_{t}}\right)^{\varrho-1}=\phi_{c,t}(1-\theta)\frac{y_{c,t}}{n_{t}}
\]
\[
(1-\varphi)l^{\gamma}\left(\frac{m_{t}}{l_{t}}\right)^{\varrho-1}=\phi_{s,t}(1-\nu)\frac{y_{s,t}}{m_{t}}
\]
\[
\phi_{c,t}=\beta E\left[1-\delta+\theta\left(\frac{y_{c,t+1}}{k_{c,t+1}}\right)\right]\phi_{c,t+1}
\]
\[
\phi_{c,t}\theta\left(\frac{y_{c,t}}{k_{c,t}}\right)=\phi_{s,t}\nu\left(\frac{y_{s,t}}{k_{s,t}}\right)
\]
At the steady state first eliminate the multipliers
\[
\varphi l^{\gamma}\left(\frac{n}{l}\right)^{\varrho-1}=\omega c^{-\sigma}\left(\frac{c_{c}}{c}\right)^{\rho-1}(1-\theta)\frac{y_{c}}{n}
\]
\[
(1-\varphi)l^{\gamma}\left(\frac{m}{l}\right)^{\varrho-1}=(1-\omega)c^{-\sigma}\left(\frac{c_{s}}{c}\right)^{\rho-1}(1-\nu)\frac{y_{s}}{m}
\]
\[
\frac{k_{c}}{y_{c}}=\frac{\theta}{\frac{1}{\beta}-1+\delta}
\]
\[
\omega\theta\left(\frac{y_{c}}{k_{c}}\right)=\nu(1-\omega)\left(\frac{c_{s}}{c_{c}}\right)^{\rho-1}\left(\frac{y_{s}}{k_{s}}\right)
\]
Taking ratios for the first two equations, we can eliminate the aggregate
$c,l$: 
\[
\left(\frac{\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)\left(\frac{n}{m}\right)^{\varrho}=\left(\frac{\omega}{1-\omega}\right)\left(\frac{c_{c}}{c_{s}}\right)^{\rho-1}\left(\frac{1-\theta}{1-\nu}\right)\left(\frac{y_{c}}{y_{s}}\right)
\]
Now lets define constants
\[
\bar{n}=\frac{n}{y_{c}},\bar{m}=\frac{m}{y_{s}},\bar{c}_{c}=\frac{c_{c}}{y_{c}},\bar{k}_{c}=\frac{k_{c}}{y_{c}},\bar{k}_{s}=\frac{k_{s}}{y_{s}}
\]
These constants solve
\[
\bar{k}_{c}=\frac{\theta}{\frac{1}{\beta}-1+\delta}
\]
\[
\bar{c}_{c}=1-\delta[\bar{k}_{c}+\bar{k}_{s}\left(\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}\right)]
\]
\[
\bar{n}=\left[A\bar{k}_{c}^{\theta}\right]^{\frac{-1}{1-\theta}}
\]
\[
\bar{m}=\left[Z\bar{k}_{s}^{\nu}\right]^{\frac{-1}{1-\nu}}
\]
The steady state now solves the following two equations in $\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}$and
$\bar{k}_{s}$
\begin{equation}
1=\left(\frac{\nu(1-\omega)}{\omega\theta}\right)\left(\frac{1}{\bar{c_{c}}}\right)^{\rho-1}\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{k}_{s}}\right)\left(\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}\right)^{\rho-1}\label{ss1}
\end{equation}
\begin{equation}
\left(\frac{\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{n}}{\bar{m}}\right)^{\varrho}=\left(\frac{\omega}{1-\omega}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{c}_{c}}{1}\right)^{\rho-1}\left(\frac{1-\theta}{1-\nu}\right)\left(\frac{y_{c}}{y_{s}}\right)^{\rho-\varrho}\label{ss2}
\end{equation}
To bring it down to one equation in one unknown we now solve out for
$\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}$ in terms of $\bar{k}_{s}$
\[
\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}=\left[\left(\frac{\nu(1-\omega)}{\omega\theta}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{k}_{s}}\right)\right]^{\frac{1}{1-\rho}}\left(1-\delta\left[\bar{k}_{c}+\bar{k}_{s}\left(\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}\right)\right]\right)
\]
This further simplifies to 
\[
\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}\left(1+\delta\bar{k}_{s}\left[\left(\frac{\nu(1-\omega)}{\omega\theta}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{k}_{s}}\right)\right]^{\frac{1}{1-\rho}}\right)=\left[\left(\frac{\nu(1-\omega)}{\omega\theta}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{k}_{s}}\right)\right]^{\frac{1}{1-\rho}}\left(1-\delta\bar{k}_{c}\right)
\]
 or equivalently
\begin{equation}
\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}=\frac{\left[\left(\frac{\nu(1-\omega)}{\omega\theta}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{k}_{s}}\right)\right]^{\frac{1}{1-\rho}}\left(1-\delta\bar{k}_{c}\right)}{\left(1+\delta\bar{k}_{s}\left[\left(\frac{\nu(1-\omega)}{\omega\theta}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{k}_{s}}\right)\right]^{\frac{1}{1-\rho}}\right)}\label{yratio}
\end{equation}
and substituting (\ref{yratio}) in (\ref{ss2}) we have 
\begin{equation}
1=\left(\frac{\omega(1-\theta)}{(1-\omega)(1-\nu)}\right)\left(\frac{1-\varphi}{\varphi}\right)\left(\frac{\left[Z\bar{k}_{s}^{\nu}\right]^{\frac{-1}{1-\nu}}}{\bar{n}}\right)^{\varrho}\left[\left(\frac{\theta\bar{k}_{s}}{\nu\bar{k}_{c}}\right)\left(\frac{\omega}{1-\omega}\right)\right]^{\frac{\varrho-\rho}{\rho-1}}\left(\frac{\left(1-\delta\bar{k}_{c}\right)}{1+\delta\bar{k}_{s}\left[\left(\frac{\nu(1-\omega)}{\omega\theta}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{k}_{s}}\right)\right]^{\frac{1}{1-\rho}}}\right)^{\varrho-1}\label{ssfinal}
\end{equation}
To compute the SS, we need to solve (\ref{ssfinal}) for $\bar{k}_{s}$.
Finally we can back out $p$ using 
\[
p=\frac{\theta\bar{k}_{s}}{\nu\bar{k}_{c}}
\]
As a illustration let $\rho=0,\varrho=1$ and $\omega=\varphi=0.5$
we can simplify (\ref{ssfinal}) to get 
\[
1=\left(\frac{(1-\theta)}{(1-\nu)}\right)\left(\frac{\left[Z\bar{k}_{s}^{\nu}\right]^{\frac{-1}{1-\nu}}}{\bar{n}}\right)\left[\frac{\theta\bar{k}_{s}}{\nu\bar{k}_{c}}\right]^{-1}
\]
Collecting terms with $\bar{k}_{s}$ we have 
\[
\bar{k}_{s}=\frac{1}{Z}\left[\left(\frac{(1-\theta)}{(1-\nu)}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{n}}\right)\left(\frac{\nu}{\theta}\right)\right]^{1-\nu}
\]
and 
\[
p=\left(\frac{\theta}{Z\nu\bar{k}_{c}}\right)\left[\left(\frac{(1-\theta)}{(1-\nu)}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{k}_{c}}{\bar{n}}\right)\left(\frac{\nu}{\theta}\right)\right]^{1-\nu}
\]

\begin{comment}
Define constants $\left\{ \bar{n},\bar{k}_{c},\bar{c}_{c}\right\} $
such that at the steady state we have $n=\bar{n}y_{c}$, $k_{c}=\bar{k}_{c}y_{c}$,
and $c_{c}=\bar{c}_{c}y_{c}$. These constants are related to each
other by:
\[
\bar{k}_{c}=\frac{\theta}{\frac{1}{\beta}-1+\delta}
\]
\[
\bar{c}_{c}=1-\delta\bar{k_{c}}
\]
\[
\bar{n}=\left[A\bar{k}_{c}^{\theta}\right]^{\frac{-1}{1-\theta}}
\]
If we fix $\beta$ to match some targeted values for $\bar{k}_{c}$
the steady state boils down to solving the following two equations
in two unknowns $\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}},\bar{k}_{s}$. The detailed steps
are given later

\[
\left(\frac{1}{\bar{c}_{c}}\right)^{\rho-1}\left(\frac{1-\omega}{\omega}\right)\left(\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}\right)^{\rho-1}=\frac{\theta\bar{k}_{s}}{\nu\bar{k}_{c}}
\]
\[
\frac{(1-\omega)(1-\nu)}{\omega(1-\theta)\bar{c_{c}}^{\rho-1}}=\left(\frac{1-\varphi}{\varphi}\right)\left(\frac{\bar{m}(\bar{k}_{s})}{\bar{n}}\right)^{\varrho}\left(\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}\right)^{\varrho-\rho}
\]
where
\[
\bar{m}(\bar{k}_{s})=\left[Z\bar{k}_{s}^{\nu}\right]^{\frac{-1}{1-\nu}}
\]
This can be further simplified by substituting $\frac{y_{s}}{y_{c}}$
to obtain one equation in $\bar{k}_{s}:$
\[
1=\left(\frac{\omega(1-\theta)}{(1-\omega)(1-\nu)}\right)\left(\frac{1-\varphi}{\varphi}\right)\left(\frac{\left[Z\bar{k}_{s}^{\nu}\right]^{\frac{-1}{1-\nu}}}{\bar{n}}\right)^{\varrho}\left[\left(\frac{\theta\bar{k}_{s}}{\nu\bar{k}_{c}}\right)\left(\frac{\omega}{1-\omega}\right)\right]^{\frac{\varrho-\rho}{\rho-1}}\left(\frac{1}{\bar{c}_{c}}\right)^{1-\varrho}
\]
Note this equation can be explicitly solved for $\bar{k}_{s}.$ Finally
we can back out $p$ using 
\[
p=\frac{\theta\bar{k}_{s}}{\nu\bar{k}_{c}}
\]


\section{Detailed steps/verification}
\end{comment}

\begin{comment}

\section{Static }

Assume that there is no capital and no savings. Further restrict the
productivities in both activities to satisfy $\log z=\delta_{0}+\delta_{1}\log\epsilon$

HH solve 
\[
\max_{c_{c},c_{s},n,m}\frac{\left[\omega c_{c}^{\rho}+(1-\omega)c_{s}^{\rho}\right]^{\frac{1-\sigma}{\rho}}}{1-\sigma}-\frac{\left[\varphi n^{\varrho}+(1-\varphi)m^{\varrho}\right]^{\frac{1+\gamma}{\varrho}}}{1+\gamma}
\]
 subject to 
\[
c_{c}+pc_{s}=\epsilon n+pzm
\]

The FOC for this problem are 
\[
\omega c^{-\sigma}\left(\frac{c_{c}}{c}\right)^{\rho-1}=\phi
\]
\[
(1-\omega)c^{-\sigma}\left(\frac{c_{s}}{c}\right)^{\rho-1}=p\phi
\]
\[
\varphi l^{\gamma}\left(\frac{n}{l}\right)^{\varrho-1}=\epsilon\phi
\]
\[
(1-\varphi)l^{\gamma}\left(\frac{m}{l}\right)^{\varrho-1}=pz\phi
\]

Thus for a given $p$ the ratios of consumptions and effort across
goods are pinned down
\[
\frac{c_{s}}{c_{c}}=\left(\frac{p\omega}{1-\omega}\right)^{\frac{1}{\rho-1}}
\]
\[
\frac{m}{n}=\left(\frac{p\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)^{\frac{1}{\varrho-1}}\left(\frac{z}{\epsilon}\right)^{\frac{1}{\varrho-1}}
\]

Now to obtain the complete allocation use 

\[
c[c_{c}]\equiv\left[\omega c_{c}^{\rho}+(1-\omega)c_{s}^{\rho}\right]^{\frac{1}{\rho}}=\left[\omega+(1-\omega)\left(\frac{p\omega}{1-\omega}\right)^{\frac{\rho}{\rho-1}}\right]^{\frac{1}{\rho}}c_{c}
\]
\[
l(n)\equiv\left[\varphi n^{\varrho}+(1-\varphi)m^{\varrho}\right]^{\frac{1}{\varrho}}=n\left[\varphi+(1-\varphi)\left(\frac{p\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)^{\frac{\varrho}{\varrho-1}}\left(\frac{z}{\epsilon}\right)^{\frac{\varrho}{\varrho-1}}\right]^{\frac{1}{\varrho}}
\]
For a given $p$ we have
\[
\epsilon(1-\omega)\left[\omega+(1-\omega)\left(\frac{p\omega}{1-\omega}\right)^{\frac{\rho}{\rho-1}}\right]^{\frac{-\sigma(1-\rho)}{\rho}}c_{c}^{-\sigma(1-\rho)+\rho-1}=\varphi n^{\gamma(1-\varrho)+\varrho-1}\left[\varphi+(1-\varphi)\left(\frac{p\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)^{\frac{\varrho}{\varrho-1}}\left(\exp\{\delta_{0}\}\epsilon^{\delta_{1}-1}\right)^{\frac{\varrho}{\varrho-1}}\right]^{\frac{\gamma(1-\varrho)}{\varrho}}
\]

\[
\left[\left(\frac{p\omega}{1-\omega}\right)^{\frac{-1}{\rho-1}}+p\right]\left(\frac{p\omega}{1-\omega}\right)^{\frac{1}{\rho-1}}c_{c}=\epsilon n\left(\frac{p\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)^{\frac{1}{\varrho-1}}\left(\exp\{\delta_{0}\}\epsilon^{\delta_{1}-1}\right)^{\frac{\varrho}{\varrho-1}}\left[\left(\frac{p\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)^{\frac{-1}{\varrho-1}}\left(\exp\{\delta_{0}\}\epsilon^{\delta_{1}-1}\right)^{\frac{-\varrho}{\varrho-1}}+p\right]
\]

The market clearing conditions are 

\[
\int z_{i}m_{i}di=M=\int c_{s,i}di=C_{s}
\]
\[
\int\epsilon_{i}n_{i}di=N=\int c_{c,i}di=C_{c}
\]
Thus we have 
\[
\frac{\int z_{i}m_{i}di}{\int\epsilon_{i}n_{i}di}=\left(\frac{p\omega}{1-\omega}\right)^{\frac{1}{\rho-1}}
\]
\[
\left(\frac{p\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)^{\frac{1}{\varrho-1}}\frac{\int\left(\exp\{\delta_{0}\}\epsilon^{\delta_{1}-1}\right)^{\frac{\varrho}{\varrho-1}}\epsilon_{i}n_{i}}{\int\epsilon_{i}n_{i}di}=\left(\frac{p\omega}{1-\omega}\right)^{\frac{1}{\rho-1}}
\]
\end{comment}


\section{Rep agent with capital BGP preferences}

We start with the Planner's problem since the welfare theorems hold
in this case. The guess for $p$ can then be obtained from the optimal
allocation. 
\[
\max_{c_{c},c_{s},n,m,k_{c},k_{s}}E_{0}\sum_{t}\beta^{t}\left\{ \frac{\left[\omega c_{c,t}^{\rho}+(1-\omega)c_{s,t}^{\rho}\right]^{\frac{\eta(1-\mu)}{\rho}}\left[1-\left[\varphi n_{t}^{\varrho}+(1-\varphi)m_{t}^{\varrho}\right]^{\frac{1}{\varrho}}\right]^{(1-\mu)(1-\eta)}}{1-\mu}\right\} 
\]
 subject to 
\[
c_{c}+k_{t+1}=(1-\delta)k_{t}+Ak_{c,t}^{\theta}n_{t}^{1-\theta}
\]

\[
c_{s}=Zk_{s,t}^{\nu}m_{t}^{1-\nu}
\]
\[
k_{c,t}+k_{s,t}=k_{t}
\]
Let $c\equiv\left[\omega c_{c,t}^{\rho}+(1-\omega)c_{s,t}^{\rho}\right]^{\frac{1}{\rho}}$,
$h\equiv\left[\varphi n_{t}^{\varrho}+(1-\varphi)m_{t}^{\varrho}\right]^{\frac{1}{\varrho}}$
and $l\equiv1-h$

The F.O.C with respect to $c_{c},c_{s},n$
\[
\omega\eta c^{\left[\eta(1-\mu)-\rho\right]}l^{(1-\eta)(1-\mu)}c_{c}^{\rho-1}=\phi_{c}
\]
\[
(1-\omega)\eta c^{\left[\eta(1-\mu)-\rho\right]}l^{(1-\eta)(1-\mu)}c_{s}^{\rho-1}=\phi_{s}
\]
\[
\varphi(1-\eta)c^{\eta(1-\mu)}l^{(1-\mu)(1-\eta)-1}n^{\varrho-1}h^{1-\varrho}=\phi_{c}(1-\theta)\frac{y_{c}}{n}
\]

\[
(1-\varphi)(1-\eta)c^{\eta(1-\mu)}l^{(1-\mu)(1-\eta)-1}m^{\varrho-1}h^{1-\varrho}=\phi_{s}(1-\nu)\frac{y_{s}}{m}
\]
\[
1=\beta E\left[1-\delta+\theta\left(\frac{y_{c}}{k_{c}}\right)\right]
\]
\[
\phi_{c}\theta\left(\frac{y_{c}}{k_{c}}\right)=\phi_{s}\nu\left(\frac{y_{s}}{k_{s}}\right)
\]
Divinf the first two equations we get 
\[
\frac{\phi_{c}}{\phi_{s}}=\left(\frac{\omega}{1-\omega}\right)\left(\frac{c_{c}}{c_{s}}\right)^{\rho-1}
\]
Then dividing the next two equations (focs with n and m)
\[
\left(\frac{\varphi}{1-\varphi}\right)\left(\frac{n}{m}\right)^{\varrho}=\left(\frac{\omega}{1-\omega}\right)\left(\frac{1-\theta}{1-\nu}\right)\left(\frac{y_{c}}{y_{s}}\right)\left(\frac{c_{c}}{c_{s}}\right)^{\rho-1}
\]
Lastly from the foc with $k_{s}$ we get
\[
\omega\theta\left(\frac{c_{c}}{c_{s}}\right)^{\rho-1}\left(\frac{y_{c}}{k_{c}}\right)=\nu(1-\omega)\left(\frac{y_{s}}{k_{s}}\right)
\]
We end up with the same expressions as before.
\end{document}
